FuncDef:
The dn-bit-set disable command disables the device from setting the DN bit in LSAs.
The undo dn-bit-set disable command configures the device to set the DN bit in LSAs. The dn-bit-set disable command disables the device from setting the DN bit in LSAs. The undo dn-bit-set disable command configures the device to set the DN bit in LSAs. By default, the DN bit in LSAs is set.
CLIs: undo dn-bit-set disable { summary | ase | nssa }

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the DN bit in Type 3 LSAs.
-

Sets the DN bit in AS-external-LSAs.
-

Sets the DN bit in NSSA LSAs.
-

ExtraInfo:
To prevent routing loops, an OSPF multi-instance process uses a bit as a flag bit, which is called the DN bit.
The dn-bit-set disable command is recommended only in the following scenarios:
